Responsible for constraining the parameters used to construct a new Potion. This creator contains a number of constraints that are applied to newly created expiring multi party contract. These constraints can evolve over time and are initially constrained to conservative values in this first iteration. Technically there is nothing in the ExpiringMultiParty contract requiring these constraints. However, because `createExpiringMultiParty()` is intended to be the only way to create valid financial contracts that are registered with the DVM (via _registerContract), we can enforce deployment configurations documentation.text:
@title Expiring Multi Party Contract creator.
@notice Factory contract to create and register new instances of expiring multiparty contracts.
Responsible for constraining the parameters used to construct a new Potion. This creator contains a number of constraints
that are applied to newly created expiring multi party contract. These constraints can evolve over time and are
initially constrained to conservative values in this first iteration. Technically there is nothing in the
ExpiringMultiParty contract requiring these constraints. However, because `createExpiringMultiParty()` is intended
to be the only way to create valid financial contracts that are registered with the DVM (via _registerContract),
we can enforce deployment configurations here.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct ExpiringMultiPartyCreator.Params memory) view returns (struct Liquidatable.ConstructorParams memory)
function (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) pure returns (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory)
function (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) pure returns (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory)
function (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) pure returns (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory)
function (address,address,address,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) external
function (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) pure returns (bool)
function (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) pure returns (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory)
function (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) pure returns (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory)
function (address,address,address,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) external returns (uint256)
tuple(uint256,string storage ref,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned storage ref,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned storage ref,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned storage ref)

documentation.text:
@title Expiring Multi Party Contract creator.
@notice Factory contract to create and register new instances of expiring multiparty contracts.
Responsible for constraining the parameters used to construct a new Potion. This creator contains a number of constraints
that are applied to newly created expiring multi party contract. These constraints can evolve over time and are
initially constrained to conservative values in this first iteration. Technically there is nothing in the
ExpiringMultiParty contract requiring these constraints. However, because `createExpiringMultiParty()` is intended
to be the only way to create valid financial contracts that are registered with the DVM (via _registerContract),
we can enforce deployment configurations here.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct ExpiringMultiPartyCreator.Params memory) view returns (struct Liquidatable.ConstructorParams memory)
function (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) pure returns (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory)
function (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) pure returns (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory)
function (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) pure returns (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory)
function (address,address,address,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) external
function (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) pure returns (bool)
function (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) pure returns (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory)
function (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) pure returns (struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory)
function (address,address,address,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned memory) external returns (uint256)
tuple(uint256,string storage ref,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned storage ref,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned storage ref,struct FixedPoint.Unsigned storage ref)

params._collateralTokenWhitelist: UMA protocol contract to track whitelisted collateral.
params._finderAddress: UMA protocol Finder used to discover other protocol contracts.
params._timerAddress: Contract that stores the current time in a testing environment.
params._tokenFactoryAddress: ERC20 token factory used to deploy synthetic token instances.

setCurrentTime(uint256).details: Will revert if not running in test mode.

params.time: timestamp to set current Testable time to.

getCurrentTime().notice: Gets the current time. Will return the last time set in `setCurrentTime` if running in test mode. Otherwise, it will return the block timestamp.

userdoc.notice: Factory contract to create and register new instances of expiring multiparty contracts. Responsible for constraining the parameters used to construct a new Potion. This creator contains a number of constraints that are applied to newly created expiring multi party contract. These constraints can evolve over time and are initially constrained to conservative values in this first iteration. Technically there is nothing in the ExpiringMultiParty contract requiring these constraints. However, because `createExpiringMultiParty()` is intended to be the only way to create valid financial contracts that are registered with the DVM (via _registerContract), we can enforce deployment configurations here.
